result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay a fine in the amount of $2,500.00 plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge and any victim surcharges by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All applicable fees of supervision, this can be through a budget plan. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- Restitution in the amount of $0.00.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (27 pages) PLEA & SENTENCING commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed.

Assessment for Attorney Fees for this case 15CF873 and 14CF838 in the amount of $1,578.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08/04/15 to pay $100.00 monthly assessed on 14CF838.  Final payment due by 12/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.  Copies forwarded to Atty Wiechmann and the defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  9 YEARS with 158 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 3 YEARS thereafter.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $2,500; 
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be through a budget plan.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter (OR Cash bail on deposit to be applied.)  
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 
As to Count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Order GRANTING Uninterrupted Phone Use 06/02/2015 from 10am to 11am signed and filed.

Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Court grants FINAL ADJOURNMENT!  Court grants FINAL ADJOURNMENT!  Court denies defense motion for bail reduction. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Ronald Dewayne Robinson in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The Court appoints Steven Wiechmann as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Wiechmann accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
